meanings.definition: The emission of light by a substance that has absorbed light or other electromagnetic radiation.
meanings.sent1: The room was filled with colorful fluorescences from the glowing stars on the ceiling.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the fluorescences emitted by the glowing algae under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The party decorations created a magical atmosphere with their fluorescences shining brightly.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room like a beautiful fluorescence in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The fireflies danced in the night, their fluorescences creating a mesmerizing display.

meanings.definition: The property of emitting light while exposed to light.
meanings.sent1: The special paint had the amazing property of fluorescences when placed under UV light.
meanings.sent2: The safety vest had fluorescences that made the wearer visible in the dark.
meanings.sent3: The glow-in-the-dark stickers had fluorescences that made them stand out in the night.
meanings.sent4: The cat's eyes had a mysterious fluorescence when caught in the beam of the flashlight.
meanings.sent5: The watch had a unique fluorescence that made it easy to read in the dark.

meanings.definition: The process of producing light by the absorption of electromagnetic radiation.
meanings.sent1: The laboratory experiment demonstrated the process of fluorescences in action.
meanings.sent2: The artist used special pigments that exhibited fluorescences when exposed to UV light.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's suit had a secret power of fluorescences that activated in the presence of danger.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline at night had a surreal quality, as if painted with the fluorescences of dreams.
meanings.sent5: The forest at dusk seemed to come alive with the fluorescences of hidden creatures.
